How to Build a CLI Tool

Published on 2026-01-15 by Jane Doe

Building a command-line tool is one of the most rewarding projects for a developer. In this guide, we'll walk through the key steps.

Step 1: Choose Your Language

TypeScript with Node.js provides an excellent developer experience. The type system catches errors early, and npm makes distribution easy.

Step 2: Define Your Interface

A good CLI should be intuitive. Use positional arguments for the most common input and flags for options.

import { Command } from "commander";
const program = new Command();
program.argument("[url]").parse();

Step 3: Handle Errors Gracefully

Always write errors to stderr and exit with appropriate codes. This makes your tool composable in Unix pipelines.

Remember that good error messages save users time. Be specific about what went wrong and suggest fixes.

Testing error paths is just as important as testing the happy path. Cover edge cases thoroughly.
